thread.title: Crystal Palace winger Andros Townsend wants to return to Newcastle just six months after they sold him
thread.title_full: Crystal Palace winger Andros Townsend wants to return to Newcastle just six months after they sold him

author: smorgan
title: Crystal Palace winger Andros Townsend wants to return to Newcastle just six months after they sold him
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ANDROS TOWNSEND is keen on a return to Newcastle – just six months after they sold him, according to reports. 
The Crystal Palace and England winger was flogged to Selhurst Park for £13million in the last transfer window. Reuters 2 Andros Townsend wants to end his time at Palace and return to Newcastle 
But Sam Allardyce is said to have no problems letting him go for a reunion with Toon boss Rafa Benitez, report the Guardian . 
Keep up to date with ALL the Crystal Palace news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
However, Newcastle want Townsend on a loan deal with a view to a permanent transfer in the summer. 
Palace want the cash now though, so that they have funds for their fight for Premier League survival. 
Newcastle are expected to seal promotion to the Premier League this season and, with billionaire Mike Ashley’s backing, can afford to spend. 
Yet Benitez’s war chest this window has been smaller than expected. Getty Images Andros Townsend wants to be reunited with former boss Rafa Benitez Andros Townsend hits the post for Crystal Palace against Burnley Related stories roon for more From early strike against Fenerbahce to his record breaking free-kick, Wayne Rooney's biggest Man United goals RITCH PICKINGS Newcastle 4 Rotherham 0: Matt Ritchie's double leads romp as Magpies return top of the Championship HUGHES A LUCKY BOY Derby 3 Reading 2: Will Hughes clinches dramatic win as Rams close on play-off zone ROO BEAUTY Stoke 1 Man United 1: Wayne Rooney hits No 250 to become club's all-time leading scorer with stunning late free-kick MATCH DAY LIVE - Man City vs Tottenham: Gabriel Jesus on bench as Spurs head to Etihad looking for a league double over Pep Guardiola's side Isaiah on the prize Huddersfield 2 Ipswich 0: Brown and Schindler fire Terriers up to third in the Championship happy hammers Middlesbrough 1 West Ham 3: Andy Carroll scores twice as Hammers leave Boro just outside the relegation zone Moyes Woe West Brom 2 Sunderland 0: Darren Fletcher and Chris Brunt condemn sorry Black Cats to yet another defeat Benik saves the day Bournemouth 2 Watford 2: Benik Afobe's late equaliser secures point for the Cherries Luck of the Irish Palace 0 Everton 1: Seamus Coleman hit a late winner to condemn Sam Allardyce to more misery THE WAIT IS OVER Wayne Rooney becomes United's record scorer after coming off bench at Stoke to hit No250 Preview Man City vs Tottenham team news and line ups: Gabriel Jesus on bench as Harry Kane and Dele Alli start 
Palace are set to pay the next £3m instalment to Newcastle for Townsend this month. 
But that could become a loan fee with Newcastle then forking out £10m in the summer to make the switch permanent. 
It is thought former England manager Allardyce is an admirer of Hull's Robert Snodgrass. 
He is also looking at the possibility of signing Stewart Downing on loan from Middlesbrough after Aitor Karanka told him he can leave for free this month.
